comment.text: This translation key is used to display the text "Reset authentication" in various contexts, such as button labels or dialog headers. It is likely used when the user needs to reset their authentication settings, and it appears on screens related to account management or security options.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Doğrulamanı sıfırlayın' is too informal. It uses the informal possessive suffix '-ı'. A more formal and appropriate translation would be 'Doğrulamanızı sıfırlayın' or 'Doğrulama sıfırlayın'.

The Lao translation "ຣີເຊັດການພິສູດຢືນຢັນ" is a literal transliteration of 'Reset authentication.' While understandable, a more natural Lao phrasing would be preferable. "ຣີເຊັດການຢັ້ງຢືນຕົວຕົນ" or "ຣີເຊັດການຮັບຮອງຕົວຕົນ" would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຣີເຊັດການຢັ້ງຢືນຕົວຕົນ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Reinițializarea autentificării' is understandable, a more natural and common Romanian translation for 'Reset authentication' would be 'Resetează autentificarea' or 'Resetează verificarea de autentificare'. 'Reinițializarea' implies a more complex process than a simple reset.

The translation 'තහවුරුව යළි සකසන්න' while containing correct words, doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Reset authentication'. 'තහවුරුව' (thaharuwa) relates to confirmation or verification, not authentication. A more accurate translation would involve terms related to passwords or accounts.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation might be something like 'අauthentikatowan යළි සකසන්න' (aauthentikatowan yali sakasanna) or 'ගිණුම යළි සකසන්න' (ginuma yali sakasanna) which translates to 'reset account'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Ресетуј аутентификацију" is understandable, a more natural and accurate translation of "Reset authentication" would be "Вратите аутентификацију" or "Повратите аутентификацију". "Ресетуј" is a direct transliteration of "reset" and, while used, isn't the most idiomatic Serbian.
